website_summaries.verdict: An affordable pair of fully armored gloves meant for motorsports and other extreme activities.
pros: Full-clad goatskin armor offers full hand protection without the weight and rigidity of harder plastic or rubber armor
Gloves offer full range of motion for the fingers for better grip when necessary
cons: Armoring may tear after repeated extreme use

customer_reviews.title: Plastic not carbon fiber for the knuckle pads
customer_reviews.text: I took apart the glove and it's thin plastic in the knuckle pads. It is not carbon fiber. See the photo below for proof. I also pushed on the smaller knuckle pads and they bend in the same way as the larger plastic pad I removed. That said for $15-25 these gloves can't be beat for warm weather hand protection.
customer_reviews.author: Hooles

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: One can spend astronomical sums on moto gear. But, these gloves prove that as long as one keeps one's expectations reasonable, decent gear can be found at decent prices. These fit my hands well, are breaking in very easily, and provide reasonable warmth, though they haven't been tested below 45 degrees. I can't speak about the effectiveness of the knuckle protections, but I can say that they are well-positioned. Only two small criticisms, I can't seem to remove the anti-theft chip in them, and they do not work with my iPhone touch screen. But at this price you don't purchase perfection.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these as my daily ride gloves for about 3 years. They are great. I have no real complaints about them. If they ever do wear out, I'll buy another pair. They are not cold weather gloves, but they are not intended for that use. They don't work with touch screens, but again, not intended for that. I could put some conductive stitching in them and solve that problem.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the money!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves definitely feel like they are worth a lot more than their price tag. I have been riding nearly every day for the past 4 months and these gloves are awesome. I have worn a small hole in the cloth near the fingertip. I do like the gauntlet. These gloves are not winter gloves but work good for any temperature above 45. These are surprising water resistant but breathable at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Better than ones costing twice as much
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are really nice and I prefer them over ones that cost me twice as much. My thumb broke through my last pair of AlpineStars at the blinker button after one season. These are leather covered in all the right places so I believe they will last me a lot longer than my other pair. Also, big plus is even in hot 90 degree weather, my hands don't sweat in these. The only thing preventing the 5 star rating is that even though I got the L/XL size and they do fit nicely, a specific L size would fit me "like a glove."
customer_reviews.author: J Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves for your money! Pictures of old vs new. 4,500 miles almost 2 years of use. Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: 2 year update / 4,500 miles on these 15$ gloves. They are the best gloves for the money. I bought a new pair because brake/clutch fingers are getting a little thin (& everything else) but last well worth the money and just thought it was time to spend a "WHOLE" 15$ for another pair! New and used pictures. Best gloves for the price hands down! These are the same as 80-100$ gloves bur for 15$ I couldn't believe the quality of the gloves when I got them! I ride a 2017 honda XR650L dual sport! Worth the $ and trusted on street and dirt!
customer_reviews.author: David Bianca totten

customer_reviews.title: Pass on these
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on a recommendation I saw on YouTube, I don't like them nearly as much as the guy on that video. They don't fit well, the velcro strap is enormous so it doesn't do much good keeping the wrists tight, and the hook part of the velcro strap pulls on the fabric part of the gloves and gets is all fuzzy. I do not doubt it'll start tearing soon, so they don't promise to last very long. I do like the knuckle armor but overall the gloves aren't very good. They are cheap, that's a plus also.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Gorena

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, your hands smell funny at first when you ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, your hands smell funny at first when you take them off. Also, in cold weather, you have to wear liners despite them being pretty thick. I rode about 20 miles in 29 degree weather the other morning and I thought I was going to have frostbite. They take a few rides to break in properly, but I am enjoying these so far, good value.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but tight
customer_reviews.text: Got the L/XL size and they're on the small side. Hoping they will stretch out. I like the feel of the liner. Obviously not going to be waterproof but should be good for warm weather riding. Zero touch screen for my smart phone but that's ok.
customer_reviews.author: Auldphart

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, strange smell.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit and perform well. They’re hard to beat for the price. The only reason I knocked one star off is because of how my hands smell after taking off the gloves. The gloves have a strange, unpleasant smell. Other than that, they work well while riding my Kawasaki KLR 650.
customer_reviews.author: SLAPSH0T

customer_reviews.title: great for the value conscious rider
customer_reviews.text: These make good gloves for the person who is more concerned with value than any other part of the motorcycle gear game, and they look great too. The comfort is perfect, they are armored and fit well. I look forward to seeing them last for quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: KS Dad

customer_reviews.title: For short fingers
customer_reviews.text: Not as sturdy and protective as I was expecting. Construction quality is appropriate for the low price I guess, but I was hoping for better. The size L/XL is what I have, and the seem to be designed for short fingers. The knuckle protectors are close to the palm so they are behind my knuckles instead of over them, and the fingers are short overall. Normally an XL glove would fit me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Hound Dog

customer_reviews.title: getting them wet made them fit better. But they take a L-o-n-g time to dry
customer_reviews.text: Gloves are comfortable-not really sure how they would fair on a long ride. DO NOT GET THEM WET!!! These gloves got wet during my first use. Dye is almost impossible to get off your hands! Once gloves got wet stitching in fingers began to fay. They are still holding together for now. On the plus side, getting them wet made them fit better. But they take a L-o-n-g time to dry. Did I mention the dye getting on your hands?
customer_reviews.author: Douglas W.

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered second pair after 4 years wearing (and going down once). These are by far the favorite gloves I've owned. Only gripe is the Velcro loses its "stickiness" after a while. I wear them in warm and cold weather. I went down after hitting a deer at about 20 mph a few months after getting them back in 2013 and have never stopped wearing them. I've put probably 20k on them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How could anything be this affordable and still made of great quality?
customer_reviews.text: This glove is like no other and for the cost is unlike anything I've come across. You'll see and never look back. Great quality and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: SuperSexy

customer_reviews.title: Nice Feel
customer_reviews.text: For this price, I love these gloves. They have taken care of me on a number of spills. I like how easy I can take them on and off without having to mess with the Velcro. It has Velcro but I don't mess with it. Not bulky. Will buy again when these wear out. I have small hands and the med/lrg fit me good with just a little room. 7 inches from wrist to finger tip.
customer_reviews.author: Jawayne

customer_reviews.title: Gloves work very well.
customer_reviews.text: Gloves felt a little stiff out of the package which was a good sign. They Broke in well. Not waterproof, nor does it claim to be, but the gloves held up well in a 3 hour downpour. And are still functioning well. I’m using them for road and off road rides. I haven’t tested the durability in a crash and hope to never.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Snug and safe
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are incredible. They are definitely on the snug side, but they are meant to be tight. The combination of fabrics makes for a very unique and highly effective glove. It is difficult to see from the photo but there are some pads on the outside of the wrist, and the unique style of cuff makes it so that you can easily get in and out of the gloves without having to adjust the velcro, and yet when wearing them they are snug and secure. Highly recommend them for extra protection on the road.
customer_reviews.author: A. D. Neal

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: These are super comfy. Fit snug with enough flex to allow a great grip. They block enough wind on a cooler (not COLD) morning in the summer and yet plenty of vent for a hot afternoon ride. the gauntlet runs high enough to protect but allows air flow so you aren't cooked. Very subtle look. not to flashy.
customer_reviews.author: A. Braun

customer_reviews.title: Stunningly Good Gloves - Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: ...this has to be the best deal on this entire plain of existence on an amazingly good pair of riding gloves - quality wise these beat gloves many times the cost - EverRide recommended for good reasons!
customer_reviews.author: Daddio

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, solid, and a great value
customer_reviews.text: I was really unhappy with my previous gloves, so I bought these gloves. I didn't really how uncomfortable and weak my other gloves were. The "armor" built in does not take away your flexibility, and I love the solid grip they give me on the handle bars. They are too bulky to put on a helmet strap, but that's the trade off for armor. I recently saw an experienced rider really damage some knuckles just moving his bike around, and I decided to stick with good protection as a result. Not only are they good - the price is hard to match! Also - kudos to Leatherup!
customer_reviews.author: incabrain

customer_reviews.title: Worth $15
customer_reviews.text: Good for the money. However, these ARE NOT LEATHER. THEY'RE BONDED VINYL. Other than that, the material on the fingertips is a little thin. I wouldn't expect these to survive a crash beyond about 30mph
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome riding gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable and provide protection. What more can you ask for? I really like them. Wear them every day that I ride.
customer_reviews.author: TomJ

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and more breathable than they look
customer_reviews.text: I particularly like the contour and overall fit. Although I haven't, um, "needed" it yet (knock on wood), the knuckle armor looks and feels solid enough to do the job without feeling like I'm wearing something medieval. They breath more than you would think and yet are warm enough to get you to work on a 50 degree fall morning. My only reason for dropping a star is that after about 10K miles (or, about 1/3 of my riding season), part of the left thumb is only just now starting to show some wear. When it finally comes time to retire them, I intend to repeat my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan P. Volk

customer_reviews.title: Took a crash and still wear them daily
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing these for a couple years now, in 90 degree hot summer weather and in 30 degree winter, snow, hail, rain, etc. They are not water proof, but they are comfortable, and have held up pretty well. I got in a crash by myself in the middle of a corn field, slid probably 30 feet, and all these gloves have to show for it are minor scuffing on the knuckle guard. All in all the gloves are still intact, so I still wear them when I ride.
customer_reviews.author: drdoug99

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, durable, great value!
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat these gloves for the money. Good dexterity and flexibility along with protection. Everide (YouTube) recommended them and even does a brutal test with these and four other gloves...these came out on top.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Decent gloves. I’d buy them again.
customer_reviews.text: Nice gloves for the money. Description said that there was gel in the palm but hardly even noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Weekend rider

customer_reviews.title: Would consider other gloves first
customer_reviews.text: Appear good. OK seams. Uncomfortable fit but may break in. Smell like chemicals and I'm not confident in their protection in an "incident."
customer_reviews.author: B. Link

customer_reviews.title: great gloves
customer_reviews.text: these are a great pare of gloves they keep your hands warm in cooler weather. I've rode with them at night when it was below 50 degrees and my hands stayed warm but after riding for an hour my hands did get a little cold i suggest wearing silk liners with them but for now they seem to be good. they are kinda big because they come in a medium\large form but is your going to use liners with these glove that works but if you just wear these glove they are kinda big. overall they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly awesome gloves
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these gloves is very surprising for the money. Comfortable and seem durable as well. They simply can't be beat for the $ Not the best looking but who cares. Just buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Feels good and looks durable
customer_reviews.text: Feels good and looks durable. A normal large glove fits me comfortably and this is a little looser than a normal large sized glove.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: Padding is thick and the mesh breathes. Great summer gloves but your hand will get cold when the temp drops below 50F
customer_reviews.author: tyler

customer_reviews.title: Very good, comfortable but tough gloves
customer_reviews.text: When or if I wear my present ones out I'm buying another pair. Def recommend. WILL buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Al_Kydah

customer_reviews.title: Solid Buy
customer_reviews.text: Picked these gloves up after reading other reviews and I gotta say - very happy with my buy. This is the kind of purchase that makes want to repeat the buy and keep the other pair in a box until the first pair wears out. I just strolled in to work this morning - 47 degrees - I do have grip warmers, but my hands were quite comfi with these gloves. They are NOT cold weather gloves, but hey - I live in SoCal... Quality stitching and the little gel pads are nice on the vibration, the armor is in the right places.
customer_reviews.author: mafjord

customer_reviews.title: great gloves at a great price
customer_reviews.text: great gloves at a great price, they don't feel cheap at all, actually they feel like 70$+ gloves, I used them as my summer riding gloves but once the temperatures falls to the 50's... these wont do the job, but overall great comfortable gloves
customer_reviews.author: Carlos T.

customer_reviews.title: Decent option
customer_reviews.text: Comfy , wearing out fairly quickly , but good cheap option
customer_reviews.author: Francis M.

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Ive been wearing these all summer 4 times a week, for the price they are great. Leather and padding where you need it, breathable, good fit and feel. The negatives are they stink. They aren't good in cold weather (below 40F). And the palms seem to bunch up a bit on me while riding.
customer_reviews.author: DS76

customer_reviews.title: I like these gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this gloves for a few weeks now and I really like them. They feel sturdy, seem to have decent protection and they fit well. It has been close to 90 degrees several times already and the ventilation on these gloves are very good. When taking them off, my hands have been dry, every single time. I was surprised, I really thought these were going to be hot in hot weather, but so far, they have been great!
customer_reviews.author: D. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Not consistant from left to right
customer_reviews.text: Would be great if both gloves made at same time or by the same person. One glove was definitely slightly different in materials and not exact same size. Probably not the case for many. I dont like how the velcro cuff was executed. Will provide excellent protection.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Some of the protection broke after short time but they still great after few years of use
customer_reviews.author: Tomer Nahum

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves for the price. They are comfortable and appear to have adequate protection in case of a fall. They also have pretty good ventilation. They are a good value and would recommend to others
customer_reviews.author: Gonzonator

customer_reviews.title: great product but....
customer_reviews.text: first of all. the gloves themselves are great. seems they will last a long time. i ordered a large/XL size. normally on an alpinestar glove (like the smx-2), im XL. these were a little big for me. im returning mine because of two things; i need a size smaller. and they sent me two right hand gloves, no left (hence why i gave it 3 stars). also one of them had a little scuff marks on the knuckle. the gloves are, like ive mentioned earlier, great. i might die the bluish grey part of them to black when i get another one :)
customer_reviews.author: imelda

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Nice gloves great deal for the cash would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Ben B

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for a good price....
customer_reviews.text: These are great for the price...good goat skin leather....protection in the right places...a good fit....I got the Large/XL....which is the normal size for me....These feel premium at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: JMZ

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like these
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like these immediately so I returned them. Ugly, uncomfortable and I didn't feel like my hand were protected at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: good gloves, had a stitch come undone but it sewed right back up just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Scot

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: Close fitting like a bike glove should be but flexes well for gripping. Quality build.
customer_reviews.author: haycreek

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these hoping for something more comfortable, about 2 weeks into using them, I dont like the fit much, it feels like something hard is pushing against my palm in the glove which makes it hurt after awhile. then the end of one of the fingers split open after having it for about a month. I'll be spending a little more on a better glove next time
customer_reviews.author: Justin schnirch

customer_reviews.title: awesome gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves! Very comfy and cool looking. Can't beat the price! You're hands will smell like new leather fire a while after riding but they are very nice. I definitely recommend this as right now. Well see after a season or two how they look/feel.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, durable, affordable. Bought a second pair for the future, and another pair as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice gloves for the price. The armor in them feel very strong and protective. Some of the little armored pads along the thumb and wrist though are uncomfortable but I'm sure they will be better once broken in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits true to size and the armor looks like it will provide adequate protection
customer_reviews.text: Fits true to size and the armor looks like it will provide adequate protection. Let's hope I don't have to put it to the test! Nice product for the money...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like them but they are also the only riding gloves ...
customer_reviews.text: I have owned these gloves before. I used them for several seasons and the Velcro pulled apart. I really like them but they are also the only riding gloves I have ever owned so I don't have much to compare them to. The gel in the palm really helps with the vibration and from having my hands fall asleep on long rides.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable, seem to offer above average protection banging ...
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable, seem to offer above average protection banging them around. One star off for funky smell that never fully goes away, even after you are them out. Its like that jean dye smell that you get on cheap Pakistani made pants.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for everday nothing fancy
customer_reviews.text: Not the prettiest but they seem safe padding on each joint and wrist protection don't hesitate to go extra large as they came a bit small, 9000 miles rain or shine they work great just get super cold on cold days in the rain
customer_reviews.author: Benjiboi666

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: It does the job for the most part. My hands are big enough that I need this size, but not that big, so it feels funny sometime when I am pulling on the throttle. That's why I docked one star. Otherwise, the padding on the knuckles gives me the feeling that it will protect me during a fall and I hope that I will never have to find out.
customer_reviews.author: Sanjay Shankar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Other than being a little stinky at first, these are the best gloves out there for the price. Probably going to buy another pair for back up.
customer_reviews.author: Dddd

customer_reviews.title: great protection
customer_reviews.text: I just received these and have yet to break them in --they are a bit stiff. These gloves provide great protection w/out being cumbersome. I'm confident the stiffness will wear down the way leather always does. They are reasonably comfortable on 90 degree days too. I would buy them again. I'll update if they don't hold up but they seem well constructed so I'm not concerned.
customer_reviews.author: btb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: These gloves blew me away for the price. They are made well and are an excellent value for the price. Don't hesitate to pull the trigger on these!
customer_reviews.author: SouthwestIron

customer_reviews.title: great gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are not as bulky as they look. They are cool for hot weather riding. Have armor in all the right places. I have a smaller hand. I wear medium latex gloves. These are a little big, but not bad, I can still work my chin strap and zippers with them. Not painful as the other guy said. Good glove and inconspicuous. Not for cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Hilles

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The gloves feel great but the stitching could be better
customer_reviews.author: Donte

customer_reviews.title: i liked the look and they never ripped on me
customer_reviews.text: for the money they are ok. i liked the look and they never ripped on me. but stitching is meh and the carbon fiber inserts broke from just me bending them. but they did fit well. if i needed another pair of knockaround riding gloves id grab another pair. but after leather gloves its hard to go back lol
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Shackleford

customer_reviews.title: They get very hot, but built well. Ideal for moderate temperatures
customer_reviews.text: Built well, ideal for moderate temperatures. Not anything above 90*F
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gloves. I don't think their are better gloves for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Frosty

customer_reviews.title: Good and not so good
customer_reviews.text: Gloves fit well and will offer protection. Can't understand why it took a week to ship. Guess they had to wait for the boat to dock
customer_reviews.author: Honest Abe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: best money spent on gloves! fit great nice thick soft leather
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Second pair I've had. First pair fell apart after 7 or 8 years. Can't ask more for the price
customer_reviews.author: Al Quickel

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I have only used these once so far but I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Edmondson

customer_reviews.title: Great leather gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, I've been using them for 2 years with my scooter and still complete. Not all-weather, avoid rain.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Romero

customer_reviews.title: Decent protection but uncomfortable seams
customer_reviews.text: These gloves provide decent hand protection and are OK for warm weather, but the venting makes them unwearable in cool to cold weather without a liner. The stitched seams inside the fingertips are bulky and uncomfortable. If the gloves get damp they tend to make your hands turn black.
customer_reviews.author: Tim is me

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband for Christmas thinking they would be nice to protect his hands. He was quick to let me know after he used them ,not only were they very comfortable ,but they kept his hands warm from the freezing air. He said they flexed well so he had a could maintain a good grip in his handles and really loves to ride his bike with them.
customer_reviews.author: K. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable gloves for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, very nice design, strong material, and quite comfortable. An excellent deal.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Parra

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw, glove fingers are too short.
customer_reviews.text: Quality glove but a definite flaw in the design. My hand is a large in any glove but the fingers in this glove were too small for a large glove. An XL glove may have had long enough fingers but it would be too big for my hand. Fix that and it's a great glove.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: These have been great. I wear them on the dirt and on the road. They will turn your hands black on ocassion but they are comfortable and cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Gloves are great. Easy to put on, have padding in all the right spots. They look pretty cool too. However, the first few times I've worn them they leave my hands dirty. They dye seems to transfer to them and that sucks. I'm expecting that to stop soon. I also found that the tips of the fingers have a hem that sometimes catches under your nail and can be uncomfortable if your nails need a trim or the gloves are on too tight. Neither of these are big issues, however, and I'm very satisfied with the gloves - especially considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rollin C. Kent

customer_reviews.title: Wore on atv trip to Pennsylvania. Brand new when ...
customer_reviews.text: Wore on atv trip to Pennsylvania. Brand new when I started, road 2 hard days on atv with oury grips. Gloves held up ok, with only some stitching failing along the small patches on the fingers. No holes opened up. Hands stayed warm on 40 degree morning. Can't beat them for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too tight on hands. Order 1 size up because ...
customer_reviews.text: Too tight on hands. Order 1 size up because of the armor.
customer_reviews.author: Kee D.

customer_reviews.title: L/XL very small.  Had to return.
customer_reviews.text: I really wish they made a larger size. I'd buy again immediately if they'd make a XXL!
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Great general riding gloves!
customer_reviews.text: They are definitely not good for the winter as the sides of the fingers are of a synthetic material. However, my hands are fine in the Spring, Summer, and Fall. I am confident that these gloves would protect me in a crash. I would consider them half gauntlets.
customer_reviews.author: Rikimusha

customer_reviews.title: these gloves are great
customer_reviews.text: I feel like a badass everytime I put them on, they wont protect you from bending your fingers sideways, but for the money, these are great quality and great protection. Like other people have said, they run a little small, I got extra large and I usually wear large and they fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan A. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and we'll constructed g!over. Wish the had more color choices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you want a good inexpensive glove, this is it.
customer_reviews.text: Bang for your buck. This is the best glove you can buy. Thanks China.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gloves. Comfortable in spring, summer, and fall. I’m very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Fishin' Fool

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money. they are strong.
customer_reviews.text: good materials, I am buying my 2nd pair (lost one, they were still good after 15k Km of rain , sun , dust, conmuting. all year round)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: If the cuff was a little wider and an inch longer I would have gave it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves and great material and fit awesome really recommend for the price
customer_reviews.author: MotoSlim

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed and offer good protection. They do not limit mobility and offer ...
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed and offer good protection. They do not limit mobility and offer a decent amount of warmth although I would not count on them to keep my hands warm if it was below 50
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Bush

customer_reviews.title: Durable & Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these gloves. They stand up well to a lot of abuse. When he lost his first pair, he asked for the exact same pair as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Nella  M.

customer_reviews.title: Well made and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves and a perfect fit for me. My first pair lasted for 5 years. Love them so much I bought another pair.
customer_reviews.author: MOSE717

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: The gloves fit my son’s hands nicely and he loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Cinders

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The gloves aren't bad for warm weather riding. They are not that protective; the knuckle guard is a thinner plastic and the fabric doesn't seem that resilient. The seem like you get the value you pay for, if you want better gloves you're going to have to pay more.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hyde

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best of the best gloves can you buy excellent
customer_reviews.author: Ios

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfect
customer_reviews.text: Couldnt comment on durability but they fit perfect right out of the box and for @ 10 bucks you cant beat them.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Gunness

customer_reviews.title: kawa ninja
customer_reviews.text: I've put 500km on my ride and find these gloves perfect, although 5 degrees and colder you will find them cold. Otherwise they will be fine for the summer. Cheap buy, fair quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best 15 dollar pair of gloves I've ever owned. Superb Quality!
customer_reviews.author: The Burge

customer_reviews.title: Quality gloves and at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves for the money. I think they offer very good protection against roadway spills. Hopefully will never have to experience that. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Brim

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves, they make my motorcycle go faster!
customer_reviews.author: Rhein223

customer_reviews.title: Nice armored gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are my go-to warm weather gloves. They are not suitable for colder weather due to a mesh construction and short sleeves that can't serve as gauntlets. I felt they were a good value for the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Singer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gloves for the price. Would recommend for anyone that needs an affordable glove but also needs plenty of protection. I use this glove for dual sport riding.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: I have been riding for many years in many different climates all over the world. I needed a apair of gloves that would be good for summer and winter riding and these, with their snug fit, overall protection and excellent price make them an ideal buy.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Lopez

product_meta.title: Decade Motorsport Street Gloves (Black and Gray, Large/X-Large)
product_meta.description: Size:Large/X-LargeDecade Motorsport Street Gloves feature full-grain goatskin leather over a spandex body for mobility, comfort and durability. The double-stitched leather runs from below the knuckles all the way up the fingers, covering an embedded, high-impact polymer knuckle cage and knuckle caps at each knuckle--providing full armor for ultimate protection.
feature_bullets: Gpact pad provides shock and impact protection
Ergonomic design allows full unrestricted wrist movement
Leather sidewalls, shapes to fingers, x stitched fingertips eliminate uncomfortable seams
Four-point fingertip construction eliminates excess fabric and provides complete hand coverage
Serious protection for serious riders, popular with street-legal two-stroke riders and owners of high-performance European racing machines

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars305 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
